section.title: Installation
section.para:
Do the installation of the Ruta workbench as follows:
Download, install and start Eclipse 3.7., 3.8 or 4.2. Eclipse 3.7 can, for example, can be obtained from the eclipse.org download site.
Add the Apache UIMA update site ( http://www.apache.org/dist/uima/eclipse-update-site/ ) to the available software sites in your Eclipse installation. Click on Help → Install New Software. This opens the install wizard, which can be seen in
Select or enter the Apache UIMA update site (http://www.apache.org/dist/uima/eclipse-update-site/ )in field Work with: and press Enter.
Select Apche UIMA Ruta and (if not yet installed) Apache UIMA Eclipse tooling and runtime support by clicking into the related checkbox.
Also select Contact all update sites during install to find required software
and click on Next.
On the next page, click Next again. Now, the license agreement site is diplayed. To install UIMA Ruta read the license and choose I accept the ... if you agree to it. Then, click on Finish
Now, Ruta is going to be installed. After the successful installation, switch to the Ruta perspective. To get an overview, see .

note.para: It is sometimes necessary to increase to available PermGenSpace by adding -XX:PermSize=64M -XX:MaxPermSize=228M to the config.ini file of your Eclipse installation.

section.para:
Several times within this chapter we use a Ruta example project to illustrate the use of the Ruta workbench. The example project can be downloaded per svn from https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/uima/sandbox/ruta/trunk/example-projects/ExampleProject
.

To import this project into the workbench do File → Import...
. Select Existing Projects into Workspace under General . Select the ExampleProject directory in your file system as root directory and click on Finish . The example project is now available in your workspace.
